pages.text: Mastiffs only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the S Locus. This gene will determine if they have lighter, fawn fur or darker, apricot fur.

The S Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'S' and recessive 's' alleles. The 'S' allele creates fawn fur, while the 's' allele creates apricot fur. Dogs with one copy of 's' will carry the apricot trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for apricot pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 's' will always create either apricot carriers or apricot puppies.
pages.title: S Locus
